SENT.plain: This is a unique case of a visceral patch rupture in a Marfan patient after a repair of a thoracoabdominal aneurysm
The patient presented with abdominal pain and in shock 6 years after repair
The retained aortic wall containing the origins of the celiac, mesenteric, and renal arteries was aneurysmal and had ruptured
Clinical presentation, diagnosis, and operative modalities are discussed
